medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began about four months prior with persistent vomiting and headaches. The patient continued to experience ongoing headaches along with periods of confusion. A new expressive aphasia developed which did not improve despite steroid treatment. Following deterioration, treatment was intensified including repeated IV steroids and mycophenolate mofetil. After initiating TPE, aphasia and headache resolved.
medical_history.past_medical_history: A history of anxiety and depression
